title: 104_hr1497
content:
The Act is titled the "Insurance Tax Fairness and Small Insurance Company Economic Growth Act of 1995" and revises the limitation on the deduction of policyholder dividends by mutual life insurance companies. The Act "Insurance Tax Fairness and Small Insurance Company Economic Growth Act of 1995" amends the deduction limitation for policyholder dividends by mutual life insurance companies. The amendment specifies that the deduction for any taxable year shall not exceed 90% of policyholder dividends or 30% of taxable income, with a minimum limitation of $35,000,000. The Act "Insurance Tax Fairness and Small Insurance Company Economic Growth Act of 1995" amends the deduction limitation for policyholder dividends by mutual life insurance companies. The amendment specifies that the deduction for any taxable year shall not be less than $35,000,000. Section 809 of the Code is repealed. The Act "Insurance Tax Fairness and Small Insurance Company Economic Growth Act of 1995" repeals Section 809 of the Code and makes various amendments to related sections, including changes to the policyholders' share of tax-exempt interest. The amendments made by the "Insurance Tax Fairness and Small Insurance Company Economic Growth Act of 1995" include changes to section 842 of the Internal Revenue Code, affecting taxable years starting after December 31, 1994. Loss carrybacks for life insurance companies are limited, and the repeal of section 809 does not impact the recomputation under section 809(f) for taxable years before January 1, 1995. SEC. 3. Small life insurance companies exempt from capitalization of certain policy acquisition expenses. Small life insurance companies are exempt from capitalizing specified policy acquisition expenses starting after December 31, 1994. 

SEC. 4. Congress intends increased revenues to be used for deficit reduction, tax incentives for small life insurance companies, and programs benefiting children's nutrition, early education, housing, and family support.
